greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest nonprime number which if used as initial term for iteration of the A000010[x] function, results in list-to-fixed-point of length=n, or 0 if no such number exists.
comment: Remark: length-of-iteration means the number of distinct terms to fixed point [including start and end]. While number of iterations[=required operations] equals length-1.
The smallest composite number is the smallest product of primes in A007755 such that the phi-iteration has exactly n terms. [From _T. D. Noe_, Sep 18 2008]
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..1002
example: Iteration lists for the first 5 terms: {1},{0},{4,2,1},{8,4,2,1},{15,8,4,2,1},..
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Sep 13 2004
ext: Corrected and extended by _T. D. Noe_, Sep 18 2008
